definitions.definition: bring one's hand or a tool or weapon into contact with (someone or something) quickly and forcefully.
examples: the woman hit the mugger with her umbrella
synonyms: beat the living daylights out of

definitions.definition: accidentally strike (part of one's body) against something, often causing injury.
examples: she fainted and hit her head on the metal bedstead

definitions.definition: (of a moving object or body) come into contact with (someone or something stationary) quickly and forcefully.
examples: a car hit the barrier

definitions.definition: touch or press (part of a machine or other device) in order to work it.
examples: he picked up the phone and hit several buttons

definitions.definition: cause harm or distress to.
examples: the area has been badly hit by business closures

definitions.definition: make a strongly worded criticism or attack.
examples: he hit out at suppliers for hyping their products
synonyms: defend oneself "if you're gonna come after me with lies and innuendo

definitions.definition: (of a disaster) occur in and cause damage to (an area) suddenly.
examples: the country was hit by a major earthquake

definitions.definition: attack and rob or kill.
examples: if they're cops, maybe it's not a good idea to have them hit

definitions.definition: be affected by (an unfortunate and unexpected circumstance or event).
examples: the opening of the town center hit a snag

definitions.definition: (of a missile or a person aiming one) strike (a target).
examples: the sniper fired and hit a third man

definitions.definition: reach (a particular level, point, or figure).
examples: his career hit rock bottom

definitions.definition: arrive at or go to (a place).
examples: we hit a diner for coffee and doughnuts

definitions.definition: be suddenly and vividly realized by.
examples: it hit her that I wanted to settle down here
synonyms: spring to one's mind "it hit me that I had forgotten"

definitions.definition: (of a piece of music, film, or play) be successful.
examples: actors are promised a pay increase if a show hits

definitions.definition: take effect.
examples: we sat waiting for the caffeine to hit

definitions.definition: give (someone) a dose of a drug or an alcoholic drink.
(of a product) become available and make an impact on.
examples: the latest board game to hit the market

definitions.definition: used to express the idea that someone is taking up a pursuit or taking it seriously.
examples: more and more teenagers are hitting the books

definitions.definition: ask someone for.
examples: she was waiting for the right moment to hit her mother for some cash

definitions.definition: propel (a ball) with a bat, racket, stick, etc., to score or attempt to score runs or points in a game.
score (runs or points) by hitting a ball with a bat, racket, or stick.
examples: he had hit 25 home runs

definitions.definition: (of a batter) make a base hit.
an instance of striking or being struck.
examples: few structures can withstand a hit from a speeding car
synonyms: slug "he received a hit from behind"

definitions.definition: a verbal attack.
examples: he could not resist a hit at his friend's religiosity

definitions.definition: a murder, typically one planned and carried out by a criminal organization.
short for base hit.
an instance of striking the target aimed at.
examples: one of the bombers had scored a direct hit

definitions.definition: a successful venture, especially in entertainment.
examples: he was the director of many big hits
synonyms: number one "he directed many big hits"

definitions.definition: a successful film, pop record, or song.
examples: he was the director of many big hits

definitions.definition: a successful and popular person or thing.
examples: handsome, smiling, and smart, he was an immediate hit

definitions.definition: an instance of identifying an item of data that matches the requirements of a search.
an instance of a particular website being accessed by a user.
examples: the site gets an average 350,000 hits per day

definitions.definition: a dose of a psychoactive drug.
